Korean: 하필 코로나도 발원지가 중국이고 그래서 의심스러운 구석이 많긴 해요 하하
English: The origin of the coronavirus is China, so there are many suspicious aspects haha

Korean: 네 여러 가지 설이 있는데 그 중국과 관련된 설에도 빌 게이츠가 얽혀있어서 미국 내에서 이슈라고 하더라고요. 하하
English: Yes, there are various theories, but the one related to China also has Bill Gates involved, so it's said to be an issue in the US. Haha

Korean: 미중 갈등이 수그러들 기미가 안 보이는데 제발 고래 싸움에 새우 등 터지는 일 없었으면 좋겠어요.
English: The US-China conflict shows no signs of abating, so I hope we don't end up with a shrimp getting hurt in a fight between whales.

Korean: 아무래도 지리학적으로 우리나라가 중요한 지역이다 보니까 그런 것 같아요.
English: I think it's because our country is geographically an important region.

Korean: 패권 국가들의 싸움에서 진짜 생각을 잘해야 하는데 그게 정말 쉽지 않은 일인 것 같아요.
English: In a fight between hegemonic powers, you really have to think carefully, and I think that's not an easy task.

Korean: 지도자 하나가 처신 잘 한다고 해서 해결될 일이 아닌데 그냥 절대악 같은 존재가 필요하니까 지금 한국 내에서는 그게 중국이냐 일본이냐로 당파 싸움이나 하고 있으니 국민들도 정신 못 차리고 아주 대놓고 타 국가 혐오 발언을 너무 많이 해요.
English: This isn't something that can be solved just by one leader behaving well. We need an absolute evil being, so right now in Korea, there's a partisan fight over whether it's China or Japan, and the people haven't come to their senses and are openly making too many hateful remarks about other countries.

Korean: 네. 근데 그게 우리나라만의 문제가 아니라는 게 더 문제죠.
English: Yes. But the bigger problem is that it's not just our country's problem.

Korean: 타 국가 예를 들어 중국이나 일본 안에서도 각자의 나라를 혐오하고 싫어하는 게 큰 이슈인 것 같더라고요.
English: Even within other countries, such as China and Japan, it seems like hatred and dislike for one's own country is a big issue.

Korean: 지리적으로 가까우면서 친한 국가들이 있던가요 하하
English: Are there any countries that are geographically close and friendly? Haha
Um... no... Kiki absolutely does not.

Korean: 사실 유럽도 지금의 관계들을 보면... 진짜 기적의 관계죠.
English: In fact, if you look at the current relationships in Europe... they are truly miraculous relationships.

Korean: 그런데도 지금 보면 관계가 완전히 좋지 않은 걸 보면 진짜 쉽지 않은 문제인 것 같아요!
English: But looking at it now, it seems like it really isn't an easy problem, seeing as the relationship isn't all that good!

Korean: 그래도 지금 같은 전 지구적 재난 상황에는 도울 건 돕고 했으면 좋겠어요.
English: Still, in a global disaster like this, I hope we can help where we can.

Korean: 코로나도 그렇지만 기후 재앙이 심각한 나라들도 많은데 관심이 좀 필요할 거 같아요.
English: Not only Corona, but there are many countries that are suffering from serious climate disasters, so I think they need some attention.

Korean: 맞아요. 다같이 탄소 중립으로 간다고 하는데 개발도상국들은 또 나라 발전을 위해서는 그렇게 할 수도 없고
English: That's right. Everyone says they're going carbon neutral, but developing countries can't do that for their own development.

Korean: 근데 또 기후를 위해서는 그렇게 가는 게 맞고 어떤 게 옳은 건지 솔직히 잘 모르겠다는 생각도 해요.
English: But I also honestly don't know if that's the right way to go for the climate and what's right.

Korean: 이미 탄소 배출 실컷 해 놓은 선진국들이 좀 탄소세를 많이 많이 냈으면 좋겠는데요.
English: I wish developed countries, which have already emitted a lot of carbon, would pay a lot of carbon taxes.

Korean: 우리나라를 포함해서요. 우리나라도 기후 악당 국가잖아요.
English: Including our country. Our country is also a climate villain country.

Korean: 맞아요. 이때까지 자기들 누릴 거 다 누려서 망쳐놓고 지금의 개발도상국들 보고 뭐라 하는 것도 너무 이기적이라고 생각해요.
English: That's right. I think it's very selfish to say anything to developing countries now, when they've enjoyed everything they could and ruined it.

Korean: 우리나라도 기후 위기에 많은 일조를 했죠.
English: Our country has also contributed greatly to the climate crisis.

Korean: 국토가 물에 잠기고 작물이 자랄 수 없는 황폐한 땅이 돼서 빈곤 문제가 심각한 건 결국에 저개발 국가들인데 이 정도 발전했으면 책임을 져야 한다고 생각합니다.
English: The country is underwater and has become a wasteland where crops cannot grow, so the poverty problem is serious. Ultimately, it is the underdeveloped countries that have developed to this extent, so I think they should take responsibility.

Korean: 근데 그런 거 하라고 있는 국제기구들도 결국엔 돈 많이 내는 선진국 편이잖아요.
English: But the international organizations that are supposed to do such things are ultimately on the side of the advanced countries that pay a lot of money.

Korean: 지구 멸망하기 전에 좀 다 같이 정신 차렸으면 키키
English: Kiki, I hope we all come to our senses before the Earth is destroyed.

Korean: 근데 이미 망해가고 있는 것 같아요... 키키
English: But I think it's already going to fall apart... Kiki

Korean: 기후 변화의 위기를 뭔가 온몸으로 겪고 있는 듯한 기분이랄까...
English: It feels like I'm experiencing the climate change crisis with my whole body...

Korean: 맞아요 근데 시원한 에어컨 바람 맞으면서 이런 말하는 저도 참 양심 없긴 하네요 하하
English: That's right, but I feel a bit unscrupulous saying this while feeling the cool air conditioning breeze haha
So... Kiki

Korean: 출근길에 잠시 더운 건데 그걸로 기후 위기를 겪고 있다고 하니까 뭔가 되게 웃기네요. 키키
English: It's funny how you say that you're experiencing a climate crisis because of the hot weather on your way to work. Kiki

Korean: 더우니까 요즘은 뭐 찍어 바르기도 쉽지 않아요 그쵸 하하
English: It's hot these days so it's not easy to even apply anything, right haha

Korean: 저 어제 친한 언니랑 수부지 피부 타입에 대해서 얘기했었는데 화장품 얘기도 했었거든요.
English: Yesterday, I was talking to my close friend about oily skin types and we also talked about cosmetics.
** What is your skin type?
I think it's that guy!

Korean: 원래는 완전 지성이라고 생각했는데 요새 늙어서 그런가...
English: I originally thought he was completely intelligent, but maybe it's because he's getting older...
I'm a water buff too. Kiki

Korean: 그래서 저 피부 화장 끊은 지 몇 년 됐다고 하니까 놀래더라고요.
English: So when I told her it had been a few years since I last used makeup on my skin, she was surprised.
I just apply sunscreen and go out.
My skin is getting worse because I put on makeup

Korean: 저는 신기하게도 화장을 하면 더 좋아지더라구요?
English: Strangely enough, I look better when I put on makeup.

Korean: 근데 당장은 그렇게 보이는데 모르죠 뭐.
English: But right now it looks like that, you know?

Korean: 저는 화장 씻어낼 때 화이트헤드가 같이 사라지는 기분?
English: I feel like when I wash off my makeup, my whiteheads disappear with it?

Korean: 저는 세안을 하면 더 피부에 자극이 가서 더더욱 망하더라고요. 크크
English: When I wash my face, my skin gets more irritated and it gets even worse. Hehe
So I use cleansing water.

Korean: 그게 끝이고 아침에 일어나서 이제 세안을 하죠.
English: That's it, wake up in the morning and wash your face.

Korean: 그러니까 피부가 정말 좋아졌어요. 화장을 안 해도 될 정도로
English: So my skin has really improved. I don't need to wear makeup.

Korean: 클렌징 워터를 화장 지우는 용도 이외에 그냥 세안 시에도 쓰신다고요?
English: Do you use cleansing water not only to remove makeup but also to simply wash your face?
That's it for the cleansing water.

Korean: 클렌징 워터 화장솜으로 두 번 사용하고 끝이에요.
English: I just use it twice with a cleansing water cotton pad and that's it.

Korean: 화장 지운다고 세안을 해버리니까 피부가 더 망가져서...
English: I washed my face to remove my makeup, so my skin got even worse...

Korean: 에... 저도 클렌징 워터로 1차 클렌징만 하고 그거 물로 씻고 끝이에요 하하
English: Uh... I also just do the first cleansing with cleansing water and then wash it off with water and that's it haha
Ah, the eye remover is separate...

Korean: 저는 눈 화장을 안 하니까 피부 노화가 좀 느리게 온다는 느낌을 받았어요. 키키
English: I feel like my skin ages a little slower because I don't wear eye makeup. Kiki

Korean: 저 어릴 때부터 눈가에 주름이 있어서 고민이에요
English: I've had wrinkles around my eyes since I was little, and that's been a concern.

Korean: 근데 엄마도 똑같은 모양 있는 거 봐서는 노화로 인한 주름이 아니라서 관리가 안 듣는 거 같아요 키키
English: But since my mom has the same shape, I don't think it's wrinkles caused by aging, so it's not responding to care. Kiki

Korean: 아 피부는 유전의 영향도 무시할 수 없죠. 하하
English: Ah, you can't ignore the influence of genetics on skin. Haha

Korean: 저희 친가 쪽이 피부 탄력이 좀 있는 편이라서 그게 영향인가 싶기도 해요.
English: My maternal side of the family has relatively elastic skin, so I wonder if that has an effect.

Korean: 어릴 때 끈적끈적한 거 싫어서 선크림 안 발랐는데 요즘도 솔직히 따로 잘 안 바르거든요?
English: When I was young, I didn't wear sunscreen because I didn't like sticky things, and to be honest, I don't really apply sunscreen these days either.

Korean: 그래서 선크림 바르기 싫어서 여름에 밖에 안 나가기도 키키
English: That's why I don't like to apply sunscreen, so I don't go outside in the summer.

Korean: 쌤도 지성이면 끈적거리는 거 싫지 않아요?
English: Teacher, don't you hate sticky things when you're smart?
Yeah, I really hate that sticky stuff...

Korean: 저는 선크림 진짜 목숨 걸고 발라요. 키키
English: I put on sunscreen with all my might. Kiki
It is true that ultraviolet rays are the main culprit of aging.

Korean: 원래 지성이 잘 안 늙으니까 그냥 이대로 살다가 순리대로 가죠 뭐... 크크크
English: Since Ji-seong doesn't age well, I guess I'll just live like this and let things take their course... Hehe

Korean: 키키  저도 그냥 이제 생긴 대로 살려구요.
English: Kiki: I'm just going to live the way I am now.

Korean: 피부가 켈로이드 체질이라 보톡스 같은 거 아예 꿈도 못 꿔서 이 정도 생긴 것도 감사하게 생각하고 살아야 하나라고 애써 생각하고 살고 있는 중입니다. 키키
English: My skin is prone to keloids, so I can't even dream of getting something like botox. I'm trying to live my life thinking that I should be thankful for the fact that I have this much skin. Kiki
Do you have keloid scars?
Yes, I have something similar on the bottom of my neck.

Korean: 그래서 좀 슬프긴 한데 이게 가슴 위쪽으로 생기는 거라고 하더라고요.
English: So it's a little sad, but they say that this happens above the chest.

Korean: 제 친구가 등에 켈로이드 흉터가 있는데 병원에 가서 물어보니까 쉽게 제거가 안 되더라고요.
English: My friend has a keloid scar on his back, and when he went to the hospital, he was told that it wasn't easy to remove.

Korean: 맞아요. 켈로이드 상처를 쉽게 제거할 수가 없어서 진짜 조심 조심 또 조심해야 해요.
English: That's right. Keloid scars are not easy to remove, so you really have to be very, very careful.

Korean: 그래서 저도 피부과 가서 시술받는 거 잘 안 해요.
English: That's why I don't often go to dermatologists and get treatments.

Korean: 귀도 못 뚫고 타투도 못 하고 진짜 불편하겠다 싶긴 한데...
English: I think it would be really uncomfortable not being able to pierce your ears or get a tattoo...

Korean: 아 귀는 뚫었어요. 중학생 때 키키
English: Oh, I got my ears pierced. Kiki when I was in middle school.
But fortunately, that didn't happen.

Korean: 그거 들켜서 엄마한테 정말 혼 많이 났었어요.
English: I got caught for that and got really scolded by my mom.
Teacher, have you ever had major surgery?

Korean: 아니요. 큰 수술은 없어요. 앞으로도 가급적이면 큰 수술할 일은 없었으면 좋겠는데...
English: No, I don't have any major surgery. I hope I don't have any major surgery in the future...
Is the teacher there by any chance?

Korean: 아뇨 저도 수술이나 입원을 한 번도 안 해 봤어요.
English: No, I've never had surgery or been hospitalized.

Korean: 그냥 몇 시간 링거 맞는 거 말고는 하하
English: haha just a few hours of ringer

Korean: 다행인데 또 병원 생활 궁금해 가지고...
English: Fortunately, I'm curious about hospital life again...

Korean: 아 저 안구 사실 수술한다고 입원하고 수술 진행한 적은 있어요!
English: Oh, I actually had eye surgery and was hospitalized!

Korean: 그때 전신 마취했었는데 전신 마취하고 나서 못 깨어나는 사람들 왜 그런지 알 것 같더라고요.
English: I was under general anesthesia at the time, and I think I know why people can't wake up after being under general anesthesia.
How many days were you hospitalized for?

Korean: 전신 마취면 쌤... 큰 수술해 봤다고 하는 거예요 키키
English: If you're under general anesthesia, teacher... you're saying you've had major surgery Kiki
Oh really...? Kiki
Wow, general anesthesia is really scary.

Korean: 저 수술 전날에 하루 입원하고 수술하고 하루 더 입원했죠.
English: I was hospitalized for one day the day before the surgery, had the surgery, and was hospitalized for another day.

Korean: 부분 마취나 하루 만에 나올 수 있는 시술 정도 말고는 큰 수술이라고 해요 보통은! 키키
English: It's usually considered a major surgery, except for local anesthesia or procedures that can be done in one day! Kiki
Oh really? Kiki

Korean: 저는 그냥 사시 수술이라고 생각해서 큰 수술이라고 생각은 안 했어요.
English: I just thought it was a surgery, so I didn't think it was a big deal.

Korean: 암튼 앞으로도 큰 수술 받는 일 없게 건강하세요!
English: Anyway, I hope you stay healthy and don't need any major surgery in the future!

Korean: 네 우리 앞으로 큰 수술할 일 없게 건강 관리 잘해요! 하하
English: Yes, we will take care of our health so that we don't have to have any major surgery in the future! Haha

Korean: 쌤 인터넷에서 옷 안 산다고 했잖아요 그러면 어디서 사요?
English: Teacher, you said you don't buy clothes on the Internet, so where do you buy them?

Korean: 저는 주로 밖에서 사요. 사이즈가 안 맞는 경우를 너무 많이 겪었어서...
English: I mostly buy outside. I've had so many instances where the size doesn't fit...

Korean: 특히 치마 같은 경우는 꼭 입어보고 사는 편이에요.
English: Especially in the case of skirts, I always try them on before buying them.
** Do you buy a lot on the Internet?

Korean: 저는 옷도 인터넷에서 잘 샀었는데 저도 거의 실패 반 성공 반?
English: I used to buy clothes online a lot, but I was almost always half successful and half failed?

Korean: 저는 실패가 거의 90%라서 꼭 오프라인으로 입어 보고 사요.
English: I always try things on offline before buying them because my failure rate is almost 90%.

Korean: 식품 사는 거는 주로 어디에서 사세요?
English: Where do you usually buy groceries?
I think we had this conversation last time

Korean: 저는 쿠팡 프레시 이용하고 있고요. 아니면 쓱 배달도 써요.
English: I use Coupang Fresh. Or I use Ssuk Delivery.

Korean: 저는 집 주변에 살펴보니까 식재료 마트가 있더라고요.
English: I looked around my house and found a grocery store.

Korean: 그래서 거기서 직접 사서 해 먹을까 생각 중인데... 어디가 더 쌀까요...? 키키
English: So I'm thinking about buying it there and eating it myself... Which place would be cheaper...? Kiki

Korean: 혼자 살면 직접 재료 사다가 해 드시면 더 비쌀 수도 있어요.
English: If you live alone, it may be more expensive to buy the ingredients and cook it yourself.

Korean: 특히 처음에 장류 같은 게 집에 아무것도 없는 상태라면...
English: Especially if you don't have anything like seasoning at home at first...
I guess so?

Korean: 식재료비 아끼려다가 배로 나갈 수도 있겠다는 생각이 들더라고요.
English: I was thinking that I might have to go all the way to save on groceries.

Korean: 진짜 참기름부터 시작해서 된장도 없고 김치도 없고 아무것도 없어서
English: Starting with real sesame oil, there is no soybean paste, no kimchi, no nothing.

Korean: 그런 건 확실히 인터넷으로 사면 싸요.
English: Those things are definitely cheaper if you buy them online.

Korean: 그리고 물건 종류도 오프라인보다 많아서 좋던데요 저는!
English: And I like it because there are more types of products than offline!

Korean: 역시 사람들이 많이 이용하는 데는 이유가 있어요.
English: There is a reason why so many people use it.

Korean: 요새 쿠팡 프레시 시키면 같이 배달 오는 용기 수거해 가지 않는다고 말이 많더라고요.
English: These days, there's a lot of talk about how when you order Coupang Fresh, they don't collect the containers that come with the delivery.

Korean: 아 그 박스... 맞아요 그게 뭔가 때가 안 맞으면 귀찮아져요.
English: Oh, that box... that's right. That thing gets annoying when the timing isn't right.

Korean: 그래도 계속 계속 시키는 사람은 그런 걱정 잘 안 해도 돼요 키키
English: But people who keep doing it don't have to worry about that Kiki
Oh really? Why?

Korean: 계속 계속 시키면 더 많이 늘어나는 거 아니에요?

Korean: 그니까 화나 진짜 그리고 바쁠 때 꼭 타는 사람 많아서 계속 멈춘다고 ㅜㅜ
English: That's why I'm really mad and it keeps stopping because there are a lot of people who always get on when they're busy ㅜㅜ

Korean: 응 ㅜㅜ 학교 다닐 때가 그런 경우 많았는데 요즘은 출근길 피해서 일찍 출근해서 그런지 거의 항상 나 혼자 타고 엘리베이터도 빨리 와서 좋아 하하

Korean: 그리고 운전자들이 상대 보고 여자면 더 뭐라 잘 한다 그래서 안에 잘 안 보이게 하고 다닐 거 같아.

English: I wish I could do that too, but I think I'll get other qualifications later, so I don't think it'll be the last time Kiki

right?

you?

you?

English: But they say people usually like the season they were born in, but I get cold so much that I honestly don't know if I like it

I also think spring and fall are the best
Do you know the song Winter Child?

Korean: 아 알지 알지 생일 때 친구도 불러주고 나도 부르는 노래잖아 키키
English: Oh, I know, I know, it's the song that my friends sing and I sing on my birthday, Kiki
What season were you born, sister?

Korean: 맞아 맞아 괜히 겨울에 태어나서 그 노래 좋아했었어
English: That's right, that's right, I was born in winter for nothing and liked that song

Korean: 어릴 때 노래방 가서 많이 불렀었는데 키키
English: When I was young, I used to go to karaoke and sing a lot, Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 역시 겨울에 태어난 사람들 특징이구만
English: Kiki, that's right. That's a characteristic of people born in winter.
What season were you born, sister?
That's why everyone is cute, Kiki
Yeah haha it's really cute!
Yeah, we're so cute!
Do you know that Park Soo-hong is all the rage these days?

Korean: 아니 제대로 못 본 것 같은데
English: No, I don't think I saw it properly
what's the matter?

Korean: 나이 차이 엄청 많이 차이 나는 여자랑 결혼했잖아
English: I married a woman who was a lot older than me.

Korean: 아 완전 어린 사람이랑 결혼한 거지?
English: Oh, you married a really young person?
Yeah, I think I was in my 20s...
Oh my... isn't that too much?

Korean: 근데 나이가 중요하지 않다고 하지만 난 개인적으로 진짜 이해할 수가 없어. 서로 관심이 가는 것부터가...
English: But they say that age doesn't matter, but I personally really can't understand it. The fact that they're interested in each other...

Korean: 나도 아빠뻘인데... 너무 싫을 거 같아
English: I'm the same age as my dad... I think I'd hate it so much
Oh, so that's it!
Don't you feel the generation gap?

Korean: 맞아 연예인들은 나이 차이 엄청 많이 나는데 사귀는 사람 꽤 많은 거 같아
English: That's right, I think there are quite a few celebrities who date people with a huge age gap.

Korean: 이게 연예인들은 나이가 가늠이 사실 잘 안 되는 것 같아.
English: I think it's hard to guess the age of celebrities.

Korean: 매일 TV로 접하고 또 나이에 비해서 젊어 보이는 사람들이 너무 많아서
English: We see so many people on TV every day who look younger than their age.

Korean: 맞아 그리고 특히 돈도 많으니까 돈 보고 하는 경우도 많은 거 같아
English: Yes, and especially since they have a lot of money, I think they often do it for money.

Korean: 맞아 그런 경우도 없지는 않을 것 같다 뭔가 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, I guess that's not the case. Something like that ㅠㅠ

Korean: 안 좋게 보면 안 되지만 일반인들한테도 영향이 많이 끼쳐지는 것 같아서... 연예인들이 어떤 이슈가 되면
English: I don't want to look at it negatively, but I think it has a big impact on ordinary people as well... When celebrities become an issue,
Yeah, yeah

Korean: 이번에 그 하정우 아버지도 39살 차인가 여자 임신시켜서 논란됐잖아 이름 뭐더라
English: This time, Ha Jung-woo's father was also involved in controversy because he got a 39-year-old woman pregnant. What was his name?
Ah, Kim Yong-geon!
Are you crazy?
Ah, right, right
That's even more shocking.
So it's really shocking.

Korean: 그 인도 소년이 예언한 거 봤어?
English: Did you see what that Indian boy predicted?
Yeah, I saw it
It'll be okay starting in November!

Korean: 그치 그리고 내년 5월인가에 아예 마스크 벗는다는 거 봤는데 진짜 그랬으면 좋겠다...
English: Yeah, and I saw that they're going to take off their masks completely in May next year, I really hope that happens...

Korean: 그러니까 솔직히 지금은 마스크 벗는 세상이 상상이 안 가는데 그때는 이때 어떻게 마스크 쓰고 다녔지 이 생각 들겠지? 키키
English: So honestly, I can't imagine a world where we can take off our masks now, but back then, I wonder how we could have worn masks? Kiki

Korean: 맞아 뭐 먹을 때 마스크 벗는 거 습관 돼 있을 듯
English: Yeah, I guess it's become a habit to take off your mask when eating.

Korean: 근데 나는 마스크 못 벗을 거 같아
English: But I don't think I can take off my mask

Korean: 바이러스는 계속 변이하는데 그게 내년이라고 괜찮아질 것 같지가 않아...
English: The virus keeps mutating, so I don't think things will get any better next year...
I think so too

Korean: 그리고 코로나가 괜찮아지면 또 다른 바이러스가 생긴다고 하잖아 ㅠㅠ
English: And they say that when corona gets better, another virus will appear ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 그리고 빙하가 녹으면 얼어있던 고대 바이러스도 퍼질 거라는 얘기도 있어.
English: That's right, and there's also talk that as the glaciers melt, frozen ancient viruses will spread.
It's really scary...

Korean: 맞아 그거 듣고 좀 소름 돋았어
English: Yeah, that gave me goosebumps when I heard that

Korean: 인간이 이렇게 다 만든 거잖아 ㅠㅠ
English: Humans made everything like this ㅠㅠ

Korean: 지금부터 다 노력하면 괜찮아질 수 있을까
English: If I try my best from now on, will things be okay?
I don't know

Korean: 나는 지구 멸망을 겪고 싶지 않아... 키키
English: I don't want to experience the destruction of the Earth... Kiki
Right ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아무튼 저 인도 소년 예언 진짜 많이 적중했던데 이번에도 맞았으면 좋겠다
English: Anyway, that Indian boy's prophecy really came true a lot, so I hope it comes true this time too.
right
Yeah I hope this is true

Korean: 응 맞으면 바로 해외로 도망갈 거야!
English: Yeah, if that's true, I'll run away overseas right away!
I want to go out and play as much as I want ㅜㅜ
Good idea Kiki
Let's wait until November ㅠㅠ
Okay, let's wait until November!
Yeah, let's wait hard together!
Do you go to a beauty salon near your house?

Korean: 미용실 아직 집 근처에서는 한 번도 안 가봤어
English: I haven't been to a beauty salon near my house yet.

Korean: 그럼 미용실 계속 다른 데 가?
English: Then, should I keep going to other beauty salons?

Korean: 흠 원래 진주랑 울산에서는 가던 선생님한테만 받았었는데...
English: Hmm, originally I only received it from the teacher I went to in Jinju and Ulsan...

Korean: 서울에서는 아직 한 번밖에 안 가봤어
English: I've only been to Seoul once
But it wasn't that great

Korean: 맞아 별로인데 많아서 괜찮은데 골라서 거기로만 가야 돼
English: Yeah, it's not that great, but there are a lot of them so it's okay, but you have to pick and go there.
What about you?
Do you have anywhere to go?
I always have a place to go!
Oh, that would be great!
Do you like it there?

Korean: 응 맘에 들어서 항상 거기로 가!
English: Yeah, I like it so I always go there!
thank god

Korean: 근데 서울 미용실 진짜 비싸 키키
English: But Seoul beauty salons are really expensive Kiki

Korean: 난 다니는 곳이 가격이 싸서 다니는 것도 있는데 키키
English: I go to places that are cheap, but I also go to Kiki

Korean: 오 난 조금은 비싸도 되니까 제발 잘 해줬으면 좋겠어 키키
English: Oh I don't mind paying a little bit more, but please do it well Kiki

Korean: 울산에 살 때 선생님이 진짜 좋았어 엄청 꼼꼼하고
English: When I lived in Ulsan, I really liked my teacher. He was very thorough.

Korean: 그치 그럼 이제 다시 괜찮은 곳 찾아야겠네
English: Okay, then I guess I'll have to find a better place now.
Yeah, I'm a beauty salon nomad right now

Korean: 그나마 지금은 머리 기르고 있어서 다행인 것 같아!
English: I guess I'm lucky that I'm growing my hair out now!

Korean: 그러네 난 무조건 파마를 해야 돼서 미용실 중요해!
English: Yes, I absolutely have to get a perm, so a hair salon is important!
I see. Beauty salons are important!

Korean: 건강하게 살기 위해 어떤 노력을 할 수 있을까?
English: What can we do to live a healthy life?

Korean: 너처럼 살면 건강할 수 있을 것 같아... 하하 운동 열심히 하고 잘 챙겨 먹고
English: I think I can be healthy if I live like you... haha, exercise hard and eat well

Korean: 키키 근데 난 몸에 안 좋은 것도 많이 먹어서 ㅜㅜ
English: Kiki but I eat a lot of things that are not good for my health ㅜㅜ

Korean: 아 맞아 근데 식도염 때문에 강제로 건강식만 먹어봤는데 행복하지가 않아...
English: Oh right, but I forced myself to eat only healthy foods because of esophagitis, and I'm not happy...

Korean: 맞아 건강만을 위해서 살면 행복하지가 않아.
English: That's right. If you live only for health, you won't be happy.

Korean: 맞아 근데 운동 꾸준히 다니는 건 진짜 좋은 것 같아!
English: Yeah, but I think it's really good to exercise regularly!
Yes, I will continue to exercise in the future!

Korean: 응응 우리 집 바로 앞에도 크로스핏 생겼던데 너 생각났어
English: Yeah, yeah, I thought of you because there was a CrossFit right in front of my house.

Korean: 아 진짜? 근데 가짜 크로스핏도 많대
English: Oh really? But I heard there are a lot of fake CrossFits.

Korean: 진짜 크로스핏은 외국에서 승인 받아야 된다더라
English: They say real CrossFit has to be approved abroad.
Really? There's something like that?
That's new
Yeah, I'll have to look into it carefully.

Korean: 나도 크로스핏 아예 모르다가 여기 다니고서 알게 됐어!
English: I didn't know anything about CrossFit until I started coming here!
I see
I'm going to go climbing too!
Please cheer me on so I can have a great body
Okay, show me your fit body!

Korean: 응응 너도 운동도 하면서 먹을 것도 한 끼 정도는 꼭 건강식으로 챙겨 먹어
English: Yeah, you should exercise too and eat healthy food at least once a day.
Okay, I will do that from now on!
Yeah, try that!
Where to buy used cars?

Korean: 인터넷으로 가격 비교하는 사이트가 많던데 보통 그런 데서 비교해보고 사지 않을까?
English: There are many price comparison sites on the Internet, so don't you usually compare prices there before buying?
There are a lot of scams with used cars too.

Korean: 맞아 근데 중고 거래 자체가 진짜 조심해야 하는 것 같아 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, but I think you really have to be careful when it comes to second-hand transactions ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 물에 빠졌던 차나 불 났던 차 같은 것도 깨끗하게 수리해서 정상 가격으로 팔고 그러더라고
English: That's right, they repair cars that have been in water or caught on fire and sell them at a regular price.

Korean: 앗 맞아 침수차 진짜 조심해야 한다고 하더라!
English: Oh right, they said you really have to be careful with the water truck!

Korean: 전에 중고차 거래 해본 적 있는데 아무것도 모르던 때라서 그냥 샀더니 나중에 잔고장이 진짜 많았었어
English: I've traded used cars before, but I didn't know anything so I just bought it and it ended up having a lot of minor issues later on.
Oh really?
Sister, did you buy a used car? Why?

Korean: 그 호주에서는 차 없으면 다니기가 힘들었었거든 그래서 거기서 처음 거래도 해보고 운전도 해봤어
English: In Australia, it was hard to get around without a car, so I did my first transaction there and also drove.

Korean: 헉 심지어 외국에서 차 거래를 했다니 대단하네
English: Wow, you even traded cars overseas. That's amazing.
Did you buy it by talking directly in English?
No, I was dealing with a Korean.

Korean: 인터넷 사이트로 찾아보고 만나서 확인하고 했었는데 무서웠어 ㅠㅠ
English: I searched on the internet and met them to check, but I was scared ㅠㅠ
scared...
I have to take the man
It's dangerous to go alone...

Korean: 맞아 근데 혼자 사는 거 아니고 친구랑 같이 샀었어!
English: That's right, but I didn't live alone, I lived with a friend!

Korean: 알고 보니까 이것저것 손댈 게 많아서 차 가격보다 수리비가 더 많이 나가더라 ^^
English: When I looked into it, there were so many things to fix that the repair cost was more than the price of the car ^^
That's fortunate

Korean: 진짜 중고차도 제대로 알아보고 사야 돼
English: You really have to do your research before buying a used car.

Korean: 예전에 생활의 달인 같은 데에 차 잘 보는 법 나왔었는데 나중에 살 때 참고하자
English: There was a show about how to look at cars well on a show like Life Master before, so I'll refer to it when I buy one later.

Korean: 그래? 그럼 이제 너가 보고 나서 알려주면 되겠다 하하!
English: Really? Then you can just tell me after you see it haha!
No I don't like that haha
Yeah...ㅠㅠ
Okay, I'll look into it.
Do you watch TV often?

Korean: 나는 티비는 안 본 지 엄청 오래됐어
English: I haven't watched TV in a long time.

Korean: 요즘에는 유튜브로 자주 보는 편인 듯!
English: I think I watch it on YouTube a lot these days!

Korean: 나도 예능 보고 싶은 것도 다 폰으로 다시 보기 보고 유튜브로 보고 그래!
English: I also watch the variety shows I want to watch again on my phone and on YouTube!

Korean: 맞아 요즘에 폰으로 전부다 다시 보기 하기가 쉬워져서 나도 항상 폰으로 봐!
English: Yeah, these days it's easy to rewatch everything on your phone, so I always watch it on my phone too!
Yeah and it's annoying

Korean: 폰으로 보면 방에서 편하게 할 수 있어!
English: You can do it comfortably in your room by looking at it on your phone!

Korean: 맞아 넷플릭스 같은 걸로 드라마도 완결 나면 몰아서 봐!
English: That's right. Once a drama ends, I binge-watch it on Netflix or something!
I hate waiting
Oh right, a lot of people use Netflix too.
I guess you don't use Netflix?
Then where do you usually meet?
I see you sometimes with my sister's ID
I also watched it with my family of 4
Have you seen any dramas that you enjoyed?

Korean: 난 드라마는 너무 길어서 한번 보면 밤새면서 다 보게 돼서 잘 안 봐서 최근에 본 드라마가 없어...
English: I don't watch dramas often because they're so long that I end up watching them all night long, so I haven't seen any dramas recently...
What about your sister?

Korean: 나도 최근에는 바빠서 본 적 없어 ㅠㅠ
English: I haven't seen it recently because I've been busy ㅠㅠ

Korean: 근데 슬기로운 의사 생활 시즌2 하던데 그거 보고 싶어!
English: But I heard there's a season 2 of Hospital Playlist, I want to watch that!

Korean: 맞아 그거 1도 그렇고 다 재밌다고 하더라
English: Yeah, that one too, they said it was all fun
Yes, I watched season 1 too!

Korean: 슬기로운 시리즈는 다 본 것 같다.
English: I think I've seen all the Wise series.
Really? I didn't see it.
Really? See you later after the exam~
It's fun!

Korean: 여름에는 항상 공포 영화가 많이 나오는 거 같아
English: It seems like there are always a lot of horror movies coming out in the summer.

Korean: 맞아 난 공포 영화 무서워서 잘 안 봐. 하하
English: Yeah, I don't really watch horror movies because they scare me. Haha.

Korean: 나는 무서워서 아니고 공포 영화는 놀래키기만 하고 내용이 없어서 재미 없어서 안 봐
English: I don't watch horror movies because they're scary, but they're just scary and don't have any content, so they're not fun.
Watch a movie that scares people

Korean: 근데 사람 무서운 게 사실 더 무서워 키키
English: But people are actually scarier than anything else Kiki

Korean: 그 손현주 배우 나오는 영화 봤어?
English: Have you seen the movie that actor Son Hyun-joo appears in?
It's something that is displayed in each apartment building
Oh, is that hide and seek?
Oh, that seems right.

Korean: 그거 때문에 나 집에 들어갈 때 초인종 옆에 항상 확인해 키키
English: That's why I always check next to the doorbell when I go home.

Korean: 헉 나는 너무 오래돼서 잊고 지냈어
English: Oh my it's been so long I forgot
I saw that too and it was really scary...

Korean: 그치 그때 너무 인상 깊었었나 봐 나한테 습관적으로 확인하게 되더라고
English: I guess it must have been so impressive at the time that he started checking with me out of habit.

Korean: 근데 그거 실제로 그런 방법으로 사람 수랑 성별 확인한다는 얘기 있었어
English: But there was talk of actually checking the number of people and their gender in that way.

Korean: 응응 여자 혼자 사는 집마다 표시하고 그런다고 하더라고
English: Yeah, they said that they put a sign in every house where a woman lives alone.

Korean: 그런 영화 보면 진짜 범죄 수법 사람들이 따라할 것 같아서 좀 무서워
English: When I watch movies like that, I get a little scared because I think real criminals would follow those methods.

Korean: 근데 범죄 하는 애들은 어차피 할 애들이라...
English: But kids who commit crimes are going to do it anyway...
That's true too, Kiki

Korean: 아무튼 난 공포 영화나 느와르 영화나 다 잘 못 봐
English: Anyway, I'm not good at watching horror movies or noir movies.

Korean: 그럼 데리고 가서 강제로 보게 해야겠다
English: Then I'll have to take him and force him to see it.

Korean: 여름에는 항상 공포 영화가 많이 나오는 거 같아
English: It seems like there are always a lot of horror movies coming out in the summer.

Korean: 나 진짜 반은 눈 감고 있을 걸?
English: Am I really going to have my eyes half closed?
That's okay though

Korean: 여름에는 항상 공포 영화가 많이 나오는 거 같아
English: It seems like there are always a lot of horror movies coming out in the summer.
It'll stick to you like gum haha!
Do you like desserts?

Korean: 응 나 완전 좋아해 내가 어제 빨미까레 먹고 싶다 그랬잖아!
English: Yeah, I really like it. I told you yesterday that I wanted to eat red curry!

Korean: 나 그거 오늘도 역시 먹고 싶어!
English: I want to eat that again today!

Korean: 나도 ㅠㅠ 나는 어제 노티드 도넛 먹었는데 앉은 자리에서 3개는 먹을 수 있을 거 같은데 1개 반밖에 못 먹어서
English: Me too ㅠㅠ I ate a notched donut yesterday and I think I could eat 3 while sitting down but I could only eat one and a half
I feel like I've just taken a shit...

Korean: 그래서 먹을 때 내 생각은 안 했고?
English: So you didn't think about me when you ate?

Korean: 나도 디저트 좋아하니까 종종 생각해줘 그럼 키키
English: I like desserts too, so think of me often. Then Kiki

Korean: 아~ 무슨 소리~ 당연히 못 했지! ^^ 미안 미안.
English: Ah~ What are you talking about~ Of course I couldn't! ^^ Sorry, sorry.
I'll try to think about it next time!
I want to eat butter right now

Korean: 그 노티드 앙버터 도넛 먹고 싶다구? 노티드에는 민트초코는 없어? 궁금해...
English: You want that Noted Amber Butter Donut? Noted doesn't have mint chocolate? I wonder...

Korean: 아니 나 그냥 맛있는 앙 버터 스콘 먹고 싶어.
English: No, I just want a delicious anchovy butter scone.

Korean: 노티드에 민트초코 있는데 배달 가능 메뉴는 한정적이더라구 ㅠㅠ
English: There's mint chocolate in Noted, but the delivery menu is limited ㅠㅠ

Korean: 민트초코 특이한 거 뭐 먹어본 거 있어?
English: Have you tried anything unusual like mint chocolate?

Korean: 내가 오늘 아침에 민트초코 단백질 쿠키란 걸 먹었는데 나 태어나서 그렇게 화한 쿠키 처음 먹어봤잖아...
English: I had a mint chocolate protein cookie this morning and it's the best cookie I've ever had in my life...

Korean: 오, 뭔가 말만 들으면 맛있을 거 같은데!
English: Oh, just hearing it makes it sound delicious!
Mint chocolate soju? Honestly, it's crossing the line;

Korean: 먹어봤어? 그거 보기만 했는데 후기가 어때?
English: Have you tried it? I've only seen it, what are the reviews?

Korean: 아니 안 먹어봤어. 그냥 내 추측이었어 하하
English: No I haven't tried it. It was just my guess haha

Korean: 아 뭐여 먹어봐서 선 넘었다는 줄! 나중에 어떤가 먹어보러 가 보자구
English: Oh, what the heck? I thought I crossed the line by eating it! Let's go eat it later and see what it's like.

Korean: 키키 아 혼란 줘서 미안 미안 ^^! 좋아.
English: Kiki, sorry for the confusion ^^! Okay.

Korean: 우리 다음 번에 먹을 게 아주 많아. 일단 막걸리에 파전.
English: We have a lot to eat next time. First, makgeolli and pajeon.

Korean: 그럼 그럼 혹시 감자전을 추가해도 되니?
English: Then, then, can I add potato pancakes?

Korean: 나 지금 감자가 몸에 부족해서 힘들어 나 감자 엄청 좋아해서 키키
English: I'm having a hard time right now because I don't have enough potatoes. I really like potatoes. Kiki
Kiki, that's very possible!

Korean: 언니 옥수수도 좋아하고 감자도 하네? 그러면 고구마도 좋아하겠네? 맞지?
English: Sister, you like corn and potatoes too? Then you like sweet potatoes too, right? Right?

Korean: 아휴 그걸 또 틀렸네 고구마는 별로 안 좋아해...
English: Oh man, I got that wrong again. I don't really like sweet potatoes...

Korean: 언니는 집을 언니 취향대로 꾸미는 편이야?
English: Does your sister decorate her house according to her taste?

Korean: 내 자리를 보면 정신이 하나도 없잖아... 그럴 리 없지! 너는 방 잘 꾸며놨어?
English: If you look at my room, I'm completely out of my mind... No way! Did you decorate your room well?

Korean: 언니는 집을 언니 취향대로 꾸미는 편이야?
English: Does your sister decorate her house according to her taste?

Korean: 언니, 내 자리도 봐 줘. 어떨 거 같아? 하하
English: Sister, please take a look at my seat too. What do you think? Haha
There's just a place to put your feet and lie down~

Korean: 우리 자리만 복작복작 난리도 아닌 거 이미 알고 있었어...
English: I already knew that our place wasn't the only one in chaos...

Korean: 그럼 소품 하나 살 수 있으면 어떤 걸로 꾸며볼 테야?
English: So, if you could buy one prop, what would you decorate it with?

Korean: 나는 우선 예쁜 조명을 하나 장만할 테야! 조명만 있어도 분위기가 좀 살더라고~
English: First of all, I'm going to get a pretty light! Just having a light makes the atmosphere come alive~

Korean: 맞아! 나는 그래서 무드등가습기로 분위기 좀 살렸었지 예전에 키키
English: That's right! That's why I used a mood light humidifier to liven up the atmosphere. Kiki

Korean: 근데 뜬금없지만 나 정말 독립하고 싶다.
English: But out of the blue, I really want to be independent.
Very strict, solemn and serious.

Korean: 그래 진지하게 언제쯤 나와 살아볼 거야?
English: Seriously, when are you going to live with me?

Korean: 독립 선배로서 어서 나오길 내가 지금 예전부터 기다리고 있는데!
English: As an independent senior, I've been waiting for you to come out for a long time!

Korean: 그러면 조금만 더 기다려 줘. >< 독립하게 되면 바로 초대할게!
English: Then please wait a little longer. >< I'll invite you as soon as I become independent!

Korean: 어서 나오라구~ 내가 휴지랑 이것 저것 들고 놀러 갈랭!
English: Come out! I'm going to go play with some tissues and stuff!

Korean: 벌써 설레는군^^ 언니 몸만 와. 내가 맛있는 거 해 줄게.
English: I'm already excited^^ Just come here, unnie. I'll make you something delicious.

Korean: 오 거기에 이제 선물을 곁들여볼 건데 그럼 어떤 게 갖고 싶어?
English: Oh, I'm going to add a gift to that now. What do you want?
I have so many, can you handle them?
I'll extract the list into Excel and send it to you haha >
I can't afford it~
Just say one thing, just one thing...
You don't have to put in that much effort!
Then I'll wear cute pajamas >

Korean: 그렇다면 내가 언니 집 놀러 가도 되는 부분?
English: Then, can I go to my sister's house to play?
You can come to our house!

Korean: 산 넘고 물 건너서 놀러 오세요~
English: Come play across mountains and rivers~
Welcome!
Sister, do you like cars?
I think the Mini Cooper is pretty.

Korean: 이쁘긴 하더라 그게 맘에 들어! 너는?
English: It's pretty, I like it! What about you?

Korean: 맞아 미니 예쁜데 가성비 별로라던데 일단 차가 있는 게 어디야~ 그쵸잉?
English: Yeah, the Mini is pretty, but I heard it's not very cost-effective. Where can I get a car? Right?
I like SUVs.

Korean: 오 나도 SUV 괜찮은 거 같아!
English: Oh, I think SUV is fine too!

Korean: 쌍용에 티볼리가 괜찮다고 하던데 나 그거 사고 싶었었어!
English: I heard that Ssangyong's Tivoli is good, so I wanted to buy that!

Korean: 그래서 우리는 장롱면허지만 차를 살 생각은 있어?
English: So we have a car license but are you thinking of buying a car?
My friend Tivoli is okay!

Korean: 차 있으면 편하고 좋을 거 같지만
English: It would be convenient and nice to have a car, but

Korean: 차 사면 이제 정말 원래도 그렇지만 빈털털이가 될 거 같아. 언니는?
English: If I buy a car, I feel like I'll end up broke, just like I was before. What about you, sister?

Korean: 맞아! 그래서 나는 리스를 생각해보고 있긴 한데
English: Right! So I'm thinking about resigning.
How can I overcome my fear of driving?

Korean: 오오, 그럼 그럼! 내 친구 정말 겁쟁이인데 살살 매일 연습하더니 이제는 베스트 드라이버가 돼가고 있어!
English: Oh, then that's right! My friend is such a coward, but he practices little by little every day and now he's becoming the best driver!
Really? I want to practice too!

Korean: 근데 운전도 운전인데 주차가 너무 어렵지 않아?
English: But isn't parking too difficult, let alone driving?

Korean: 맞아. 예전에 폰으로 주차 게임은 아주 잘해서 자신만만 했는데 실전은 너무 다르더라. 역시 인생은 실전이야?
English: That's right. I used to be really good at parking games on my phone, so I was confident, but real life is so different. After all, life is real life, right?

Korean: 그럼 그럼! 나 아빠가 주차 가르쳐줬는데 사실 그거 아빠가 주차한 거야.
English: Okay, okay! My dad taught me how to park, but it was actually my dad who parked the car.
I guess it's too stuffy I'm Kiki

Korean: 키키 아 아빠가 운전 잘 가르쳐 주셔?
English: Kiki, did your dad teach you how to drive well?

Korean: 나는 엄마한테 한 번 배웠다가 다시는 엄마랑은 안 타 하하 이유는 알겠지?
English: I learned it from my mom once and I'll never ride with her again haha you know why?

Korean: 우리 엄마는 내가 운전하면 그 차를 안 타. 그 이유 역시 알겠지?
English: My mom won't let me drive her car. You know why, right?
I'm good at braking though...
After all, family is family~ ^^!

Korean: 브레이크 잘 잡으면 솔직히 반 이상은 한 거라고 생각해.
English: If you hold the brakes well, I honestly think you're more than halfway there.

Korean: 그러니까 진짜 부드럽게 잘 밟았는데도 엄마가 얼마나 뭐라 그러던지...
English: So, even though I stepped on it really gently, my mom kept saying things like...

Korean: 사실 운전도 그 정도면 아빠가 한 거 같기도 하고!?
English: Actually, it seems like my dad did the driving too!?

Korean: 운전 빨리 먼저 배워서 나를 가르쳐주는 건 어때...?
English: How about you learn to drive quickly first and then teach me...?

Korean: 키키 오, 그게 얼마나 빨리 될지 모르겠는데 각오가 됐다면 한번 시도해 보자! 한 5년 뒤 만나!
English: Kiki Oh, I don't know how fast it will be, but if you're ready, give it a try! See you in about five years!

Korean: 안 되겠다... 내가 먼저 베스트 드라이버 되는 게 빠르겠당 하하
English: No way... I guess it'd be faster if I became the best driver first haha

Korean: 요즘 시국엔 회식을 못 하잖아. 어떻게 생각해?
English: These days, we can't have company dinners. What do you think?

Korean: 나는 회식 못 하는 건 좋은데 친구나 동기들 여러 명이서 같이 뭐 못하는 건 좀 많이 별로야!
English: I don't mind not being able to have company dinners, but I really don't like not being able to do things with my friends or colleagues!

Korean: 나도 ㅠㅠ 퇴근하고 동료들이랑 시원하게 소맥 한잔 못한다니 정말 슬퍼.
English: Me too ㅠㅠ I'm really sad that I can't have a cold drink of soju with my colleagues after work.

Korean: 맞아! 약간 그럴려고 회사 나오는 맛도 있는 건데
English: Yeah! It's a bit fun to come out to work for that reason.

Korean: 여러 동료랑 얘기도 나누고 싶은데 이게 이렇게 힘들다고 진짜!? 않
English: I want to talk to my colleagues, but is it really this hard?

Korean: 그러니까 동기 사랑 나라 사랑 동료 사랑인데 말이야. 그치?
English: So, it's love for one's motives, love for one's country, and love for one's colleagues. Right?
That's why lunch time is so precious.

Korean: 그럼 점심시간 즐겁게 보내려고 회사 나오는 것도 있지!
English: Then, there are also times when I leave the company to have fun during lunch time!

Korean: 그래서 점심시간에 동료들이랑 잘 얘기하면서 지내고 있어?
English: So, are you having a nice time chatting with your colleagues during lunch?

Korean: 응응. 나는 수다쟁이이기 때문에 사실 점심시간도 너무 부족하고 아쉬워. 언니도지? 다 알아.
English: Yeah, yeah. I'm a chatterbox, so I actually feel like lunch time is too short and I regret it. Do you know, Unnie? I know everything.

Korean: 같은 부류 사람인 거 알고 있었어 나도 키키
English: I knew we were the same type of people, me too Kiki
I'm really chatty...

Korean: 나 얘기를 하도 많이 해서 목이 쉬는 스타일인데 일하면서는 얘기 잘 못해서 지금 많이 힘들어.
English: I'm the type of person who gets hoarse from talking so much, but I can't talk much while I'm working, so I'm having a hard time right now.

Korean: 대신 목이 싱싱하겠다 요즘은! 그러면 출근할 때는 집에서 몇 시쯤 출발해?
English: Instead, your throat must be fresh these days! Then, what time do you leave home for work?
I catch the bus around 7:15!

Korean: 그래서 일찍 내려서 천천히 여유를 조금 즐겨...
English: So, get off early and enjoy some leisure time...
Do you tend to leave work early?
What a great guy who enjoys his free time!

Korean: 나는 7시 반쯤 나오면 딱 알맞게 회사에 도착해.
English: If I leave around 7:30, I arrive at the office just in time.
Any earlier than that... it's hard hehe...
It takes forever to get to work ㅜㅜ

Korean: 나는 그래도 가까운 편이라서... 그러면 아침에 주로 지하철로 서서 오겠네?
English: But I'm still close by... So I guess I'll mostly take the subway in the morning?

Korean: 맞아 ㅠㅠ 그래서 다리가 너무 아파.
English: Yeah ㅠㅠ That's why my legs hurt so much.

Korean: 그리고 지하철은 계속 실내라서 너무 답답해 힝~ ㅠㅠ
English: And the subway is always indoors so it's so stuffy, ugh~ ㅠㅠ
I like looking outside...

Korean: 맞다! 근데 버스는 없고 오래 걸린다고 했지?
English: Right! But you said there's no bus and it takes a long time?

Korean: 응 ㅠㅠ 버스는 한 시간에 1대도 안 다녀서 승객을 태우겠다는 건지 말겠다는 건지 모르겠더라고 하하
English: Yeah ㅠㅠ The bus doesn't even run once an hour so I don't know if they're going to pick up passengers or not haha

Korean: 언니는 그럼 버스 안 막히면 금방 도착하겠다!?
English: Sister, if the bus doesn't get stuck, we'll get there soon!?

Korean: 응 나는 기사 아저씨가 막 질주하면 30분이면 강남역에 도착해!
English: Yeah, I can get to Gangnam Station in 30 minutes if the driver keeps driving!

Korean: 최근에 군대에서 의료 사고? 난 거 들었어? ㅠ
English: Medical accidents in the military recently? I heard about that? ㅠ
No? What the heck, a medical accident?
I hope it works out well...

Korean: 나는 최근에 본 뮤지컬이 군 뮤지컬인데 혹시 너도 봤니?
English: The most recent musical I saw was a military musical. Have you seen it too?

Korean: 오, 나도 군 뮤지컬 하나 봤는데 언니는 뭘 봤어?
English: Oh, I saw a military musical too. What did you see, Sister?

Korean: 나는 귀환이라고 작년까지 했었던 군 뮤지컬을 봤는데 너도 그거 본 거야?
English: I saw the military musical called Return that was on until last year. Did you see that too?

Korean: 엇 아니! 나는 신흥무관학교라는 뮤지컬을 봤어.
English: Oh no! I saw a musical called Shinheung Military Academy.
I saw Kang Ha-neul and Onew. What about you, Unnie?

Korean: 나는 시우민이랑 성규랑 배우 김민석을 봤어! 노래를 다들 잘하더라고~
English: I saw Xiumin, Sunggyu, and actor Kim Minseok! They all sang well~

Korean: 신흥무관학교는 근데 군복을 입지는 않았겠다 그치?
English: But I guess Shinheung Military Academy doesn't have military uniforms, right?

Korean: 아니 입는데? 아 군복은 아니고 무관학교 교복이라고 해야 하나...?
English: No, I'm wearing it? Oh, it's not a military uniform, but should I say a military academy uniform...?
I think so haha

Korean: 아 귀환은 완전 지금 현재 군복 입은 채로 나와서 베레모 쓰고!
English: Ah, the return is completely current, I'm out in my military uniform and wearing a beret!
Oh, that would make it more realistic!

Korean: 강하늘이 연기 너무 잘해서 나도 줄줄 울었지 뭐야~
English: Kang Ha-neul's acting was so good that I cried a lot too~

Korean: 아니 강하늘 노래도 잘 하지 않아? 궁금하다.
English: No, Kang Ha-neul is good at singing too. I wonder.

Korean: 근데 온유는 귀환에도 나왔었는데 신흥무관학교에도 나왔다니 되게 오래 있었던 느낌이네... 키키
English: But On-yu appeared in Return and Shinheung Military Academy too, so it feels like he's been around for a long time... Kiki
You're practically a military musical craftsman, aren't you?

Korean: 응응 강하늘 노래도 잘하고 연기도 잘해서 감동이었어!
English: Yeah, yeah Kang Ha-neul is good at singing and acting, I was touched!
It's fiction, but it's so touching...

Korean: 맞아 귀환은 그 중년 배우 분이 연기를 진짜 잘하셔서 나도 2층에서 눈물 좀 흘렸지... ㅜㅜ
English: That's right, the middle-aged actor's acting was really good, so I shed some tears on the second floor too... ㅜㅜ

Korean: 군 뮤지컬하면 또 보러 갈 생각은 있어?
English: Do you plan on going to see the military musical again?

Korean: 응 완전 있지! 뮤지컬도 좋아해서 완전 있어. 언니는?
English: Yeah, I totally do! I like musicals too, so I totally do. What about you, sister?
I totally have that too!

Korean: 나도 뮤지컬 좋아해서 상관하지 않고 볼 수 있으면 다 보는 편이야!
English: I also like musicals, so I watch them all if I can, regardless of the genre!

Korean: 내 친구는 총소리 때문에 보기 싫다 하더라구... ㅜㅜ
English: My friend said he didn't want to see it because of the gunshots... ㅜㅜ

Korean: 헐 ㅠㅠ 맞아 아무래도 군대다 보니까 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh my gosh ㅠㅠ That's right, I guess it's because it's the military ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그런데 총 들고 군무하는 거 너무 멋있지 않아?
English: But isn't it cool to carry a gun and serve in the military?

Korean: 맞아 맞아! 나 완전 총 들고 군무할 때 진짜 멋있어서 소름 돋았는데 역시!
English: Yeah, that's right! I was really scared when I saw him wielding a gun and doing military service, but it was really cool!
Sister, do you have any memorable teachers?

Korean: 어! 나는 중학교 때 학원 선생님이랑 아직도 연락하고 지내!
English: Oh! I still keep in touch with my academy teacher from middle school!

Korean: 집에도 가서 자고 막 그래 신기하지?
English: Isn't it amazing that you can go home and sleep and stuff?
Wow, this is awesome!

Korean: 나는 고2 때 담임 선생님이랑 얼마 전에도 뵀었는데!
English: I met my homeroom teacher from my second year of high school a while ago!

Korean: 오! 나는 학원 선생님이랑만 친해서 그리고 내가 유일하게 100점을 맞아봤던 과목 선생님이라
English: Oh! I'm only close with my academy teacher, and he's the only subject teacher I ever got a perfect score on.
The teacher said I was pretty Kiki
Wow, 100 points! Cool! I'll try to guess.
Sister, is that subject math?

Korean: 아니 고구마도 틀리더니 이것도 틀렸어... 사회야 사회!
English: Oh, sweet potatoes were wrong, and this is wrong too... Society, society!

Korean: 데헷 ^^ 나 헛다리 잘 짚는 편~
English: Ta-da ^^ I'm good at making mistakes~
You and your teacher have such a deep connection!

Korean: 응! 너는 그러면 고2 때 담임 선생님이 제일 기억에 남는 선생님이야?
English: Yeah! So, is your homeroom teacher from your second year of high school the teacher you remember the most?

Korean: 응응! 영어 선생님인데 고2 때 반 전체적으로 친하고 단합이 잘 돼서 스무 살 땐 다 같이 여행도 갔었어~!
English: Yeah! I'm an English teacher. When I was in the second year of high school, we were all close and united in the class, so when we were twenty, we all went on a trip together~!
Oh, with the teacher? Awesome!
It's my first time hearing about a trip with my homeroom teacher!
He must have been a really good teacher...
I didn't like any of my high school teachers...

Korean: 맞아 ㅠㅠ 잘 맞고 좋은 선생님 만나기 정말 힘든 일인데,
English: That's right ㅠㅠ It's really hard to meet a good teacher who fits well.

Korean: 스승의 은혜 노래가 절로 나오는 선생님이셨어 하하 물론 마음속으로만 불렀어
English: He was a teacher who would sing the song of the teacher's grace without realizing it haha. Of course, I only sang it in my mind.
No, why did you only call me in your mind?

Korean: 노래하니까 나는 고3 담임 쌤 우리 담임 맡았을 때 결혼하셔서 축가 불렀던 기억이 나네 나는 진짜 불렀어
English: When I sing, I remember my high school senior homeroom teacher singing a congratulatory song when he got married. I really sang it.

Korean: 쌤은 기억 별로 안 나는데 그 축가 불렀던 건 기억이 너무 난다 키키
English: I don't remember the teacher very well, but I remember singing that congratulatory song very well, Kiki
Wow, awesome! So cute and heartwarming. >
Half of us are singing the congratulatory song together ㅠㅠ
Oh, was that your solo song?

Korean: 당연히 애들이 모두 다 불렀지! 키키
English: Of course the kids all sang! Kiki

Korean: 그때 담임 쌤이 28살 막 이랬는데 지금 생각해보면 어리다 쌤들도... ㅜㅜ
English: At that time, my homeroom teacher was about 28 years old, but now that I think about it, even the teachers were young... ㅜㅜ

Korean: 헐 ㅠㅠ 맞아... 지금 내 나이 비슷할 때 결혼이라니...
English: Wow ㅠㅠ That's right... Getting married at a similar age to me...

Korean: 내 나이보다 어린 선생님들 정말 힘들겠어, 지금 생각해 보면...
English: I guess it must have been really hard for teachers younger than me, now that I think about it...

Korean: 그니까 그때 말을 잘 들었어야 했는데
English: That's why I should have listened to you back then.

Korean: 지금 생각해보면 조금 사춘기랍시고 말 안 들어서 죄송하당...
English: Thinking about it now, I feel a bit adolescent and I'm sorry for not listening to you...
How many people are in your family, sister?
I have 4! You?

Korean: 오 나도! 아빠, 엄마, 오빠, 나. 언니는?
English: Oh me too! Dad, Mom, Brother, Me. What about Sister?
Me too, exactly the same!

Korean: 그럼 오빠랑 나이 차이는 많이 나?
English: Then is there a big age difference between you and your brother?
I'm 4 years older than you! What about your sister?
I'm exactly the same.

Korean: 4살 차이 조금 많지도 적지도 않은 느낌인데 나는 오빠가 남동생이었으면 좋겠어.
English: The 4 year age gap isn't that big or small, but I wish my older brother was my younger brother.

Korean: 그래? 나는 이미 오빠가 남동생 같아서 조금 오빠 노릇을 해 줬으면 좋겠던데 하하
English: Really? I already feel like my brother is my brother, so I wish he would act like my brother a little bit haha
Oh really?

Korean: 근데 말하고 보니까 오빠가 용돈 종종 잘 줘서 약간 그냥 오빠여도 될 거 같아...
English: But now that I think about it, my brother often gives me a lot of allowance, so I think it's okay for him to just be my brother...

Korean: 오, 그럼 그럼. 돈 주는 사람 최고 최고!
English: Oh, then yes. The person who gives money is the best!
The best the best!

Korean: 갑자기 궁금한 건데 엄마가 환갑이라면 어떤 선물이 좋을 거 같아?
English: I'm suddenly curious, what kind of gift do you think would be good for my mom's 60th birthday?

Korean: 음... 누가 됐든 선물은 참 어려운데,
English: Well... It's really hard to give a gift to anyone.
How about cash? Wrap it up nicely and make it look like an event!

Korean: 역시 현금만큼 좋은 게 없긴 하겠지?
English: After all, there's nothing better than cash, right?

Korean: 조만간 엄마 생신이 다가와서 물어봤어 하하
English: I asked because my mom's birthday is coming up soon haha

Korean: 맞아. 나이 성별 불문하고 현찰이 최고인 거 같아!
English: Yes, I think cash is the best, regardless of age or gender!

Korean: 어머님께 생신 아직 조금 남았지만 축하 드린다고 전해 줘! 하하 ><
English: Tell your mom that she's still a little bit away from her birthday, but she's happy! Haha >
Kiki, there's a little left, but I'll tell you!

Korean: 그럼 너도 다음 어머니 생신 때 현금을 드릴 생각이야?
English: So, are you planning to give your mother some cash for her next birthday?

Korean: 응! 계획은 그런데 일단 엄마 생신 내년이라,
English: Yeah! That's the plan, but first of all, my mom's birthday is next year.
Mom, wait~ ^^

Korean: 우리 엄마도 조금 기다려야 되긴 하는데 여하튼 고마웡!
English: My mom will have to wait a bit too, but thank you anyway!
Sister, have you ever been on a blind date?

Korean: 아니 나는 자연스런 만남 추구하는 스타일이야! 너는 해봤어?
English: No, I'm the type that seeks natural encounters! Have you tried it?
Oh, I'm also proud! ^^

Korean: 몇 번 받을 뻔했는데 아무래도 부담스러워서 거절했어...
English: I almost accepted it a few times, but I declined because I felt burdened...

Korean: 근데 주위에 보니까 이제 애들이 자연스런 만남 힘들다고 다 소개팅하던데 나는 모르는 사람이랑 그렇게 만나는 거 너무 어색하고 생각만 해도 힘들어
English: But when I look around, I see that these days, kids are having a hard time meeting people naturally, so they all go on blind dates. But for me, meeting people I don't know like that is so awkward and hard to even think about.
Then what is your ideal type?
Yes, that's exactly why.

Korean: 나는 안경이 잘 어울리고 마르지 않고 예의가 바르고 나랑 개그 코드가 맞는 사람 >< 언니는?
English: I want someone who looks good in glasses, isn't thin, is polite, and has a similar sense of humor to me >< What about you, Unnie?
It's very specific. It's very specific.

Korean: 나는 뭔가 아 이 사람은 배울 게 진짜 많은 거 같다라고 느껴지는 사람을 좋아하는 거 같아!
English: I think I like someone who makes me feel like, "Oh, this person has a lot to learn!"
Oh, right, that point is important too!

Korean: 그러면 외적인 것도 말해 줘! 궁금하니까 ><
English: Then tell me about the external things too! I'm curious >

Korean: 나는 동글동글하게 생긴 사람을 좋아하는 거 같아 도경수 같은? 도경수 괜찮지 않아?
English: I think I like someone with a round face. Like Do Kyungsoo? Isn't Do Kyungsoo okay?
It's completely fine.

Korean: 나 고3 때 도경수 엄청 좋아했었어 하하
English: I really liked Do Kyungsoo when I was in 3rd year of high school haha

Korean: 나는 이장원 같은 사람이 좋아. 이장원 알아?
English: I like people like Lee Jang-won. Do you know Lee Jang-won?

Korean: 나는 지금 도경수가 좋은 거 같아 좀 키키
English: I think Do Kyungsoo is good right now. Kiki

Korean: 그 기타 치시는 분 아닌가...? 그 똑똑하신 분 아닌가?
English: Isn't that the guy who plays the guitar? Isn't that the smart guy?

Korean: 응 맞아! 외적인 것도 내 스탈이고 개그 취향이 나랑 같아 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, that's right! The exterior is also my style and we have similar tastes in comedy ㅠㅠ

Korean: 언뜻 보면 흔한 타입 같지만 주변에서 절대 볼 수 없어.
English: At first glance, it seems like a common type, but you never see it around you.

Korean: 그 방탈출에 하석진이랑 김지석이랑 같이 나왔던 분 맞지? 안경 쓰시고?
English: Are you the guy who came out of the escape room with Ha Seok-jin and Kim Ji-seok? Are you wearing glasses?

Korean: 아 맞다 이상형 안경 잘 어울리는 사람! 딱 맞네!
English: Oh right, my ideal type is someone who looks good with glasses! They fit me perfectly!
So you found your ideal type, Kiki
That's right! That's him!

Korean: 똑똑한 것도 매력인데 넘 재밌고 귀여워 >,<
English: Being smart is attractive, but it's also so funny and cute >,

Korean: 언니는 그럼 어떤 부분에서 매력을 느껴?!
English: Then what part of your sister do you find attractive?!

Korean: 내가 말한 걸 이 사람이 온전히 다 잘 들어주고 있구나라고 느낄 때? 맞나 그런 거 같아!
English: When I feel like this person is listening to everything I said? I think so!

Korean: 뭔가 그 통하는 느낌이 들 때... 이거 매력 맞니?
English: When you feel that connection... is that charm?

Korean: 그럼 매력이지! 남의 이야기 안 듣고 자기 말만 지껄이는 사람이 얼마나 많은데! 하하
English: Then that's charm! How many people are there who don't listen to others and only talk about themselves! Haha

Korean: 그렇지? 맞아 그럼 거기서 매력을 느끼는 게 맞아!
English: Right? That's right, then it's right to feel attracted to that!

Korean: 내 프로필 사진 귀엽지? 내 동물 친구들이야 ><
English: Isn't my profile picture cute? These are my animal friends >

Korean: 응 프사 매일 매일 바꿔줬으면 좋겠어
English: Yeah, I wish you could change your profile picture every day.
I want to see new photos every day!
Kiki I'll show you a new picture every day!

Korean: 언니 프로필 사진에 귀여운 멍멍이는 누구야?
English: Who is the cute puppy in your sister's profile picture?

Korean: 아 얘는 누룽지야! 친구 강아지인데 누런 색이어서 누룽지래 키키
English: Oh, this is Nurungji! My friend's dog is yellow, so he's called Nurungji Kiki
The name is perfect, isn't it?
It's so cute and suits you so well ㅠㅠ
So is Nurungji a Pomeranian?
that's right!

Korean: 근데 다른 포메에 비해서 다리가 진짜 길어 키키
English: But compared to other Pomeranians, Kiki's legs are really long.
Running around, running around!

Korean: 보리도 그럼 색깔 보고 이름 보리라고 지은 거야?
English: So, barley is named barley because of its color?

Korean: 맞아! 보리 애기 때 우리 집 왔을 때 꼬리 보니까 보리가 생각나서 보리라고 내가 지었어! 잘 지었지!? >,<
English: That's right! When Bori came to our house as a baby, I saw his tail and it reminded me of Bori, so I named him Bori! Did I name him well!? >,
It's a perfect match! It's a perfect match!

Korean: 포미는 하얀색이어서 백설기 찹쌀떡 이렇게 불러주고 싶당...하하 찹쌀떡!
English: Since Pomi is white, I want to call it Baekseolgi Chapssaltteok...haha Chapssaltteok!

Korean: 맞아 우리 포미는 하얗고 핑크 핑크해 >,<
English: Yes, our Pomi is white and pink >,

Korean: 포미는 포미, 뽀미, 돼지, 애기 등등 불리는 이름이 많아.
English: Pomi has many names such as Pomi, Pomi, Pig, Baby, etc.

Korean: 반려동물들은 애기라고 부르게 되더라고... 진짜 애기 같아 가지고!
English: They call their pets babies... They really are like babies!

Korean: 포미는 손이랑 앉아 엎드려 이거 훈련했어?
English: Did Pomi practice this by sitting on his hands and knees?
That's right. Even when you grow up, you're still a baby... >

Korean: 응응 우리 포미 앉아, 엎드려, 손, 돌아, 브이, 기다려를 할 줄 알아.
English: Yeah yeah our Pomi knows how to do sit, lie down, hands, turn around, V, and wait.
Barley doesn't do anything. Haha

Korean: 헉 브이라니... ㅜㅜ 어떻게 동영상 좀 찍어서 나중에 보여줘!
English: Oh my gosh, V... ㅜㅜ Can you please record a video and show me later!
I'll show you!

Korean: 엄지 검지로 브이 하면 거기에 턱을 갖다 대서 넘 귀여워 >,<
English: When you make a V with your thumb and index finger, it's so cute when you put your chin there >,
That would be really cute!
I really want to see it, it's my first time hearing about V-Rain!

Korean: 근데 고양이는 원래 훈련이 힘든 동물 아니야?
English: But aren't cats originally animals that are difficult to train?
Yeah, I guess so!

Korean: 가족들 생각에는 다 알아 듣는데 어쩌라고~ 이런 마음으로 안 해주는 거 같아 고양이는 하하
English: The cat seems to think that he understands everything but what can I do? Haha

Korean: 역시 고양이는 도도한 게 맞는 거 같아 아무리 개냥이래도! 하하
English: I think cats are really proud, even if they are dogs! Haha
Sister, do you like fishing?

Korean: 낚시 옛날에 낚시 카페? 가서 한 번 해본 게 끝인데...
English: Fishing I went to a fishing cafe a long time ago and tried it once...
Do you like fishing? Do you do it often?

Korean: 아니, 나는 참을성이 없는 건지 가만히 기다리는 게 너무 고문이더라고... ㅠ
English: No, I'm just impatient, waiting around was just too much torture... ㅠ

Korean: 아 근데 해보긴 해봤는데 안 맞는 거야?
English: Oh, but I tried it and it didn't work?

Korean: 응응! 우리 할머니가 낚시를 좋아하셔서 어릴 때는 가족끼리 종종 했었어!
English: Yeah! My grandmother loved fishing, so we used to do it with our family often when I was little!

Korean: 어릴 땐 그래도 조금 재밌게 했던 거 같긴 한데...
English: I think I had some fun with it when I was younger...
Wow, a fishing grandma. How romantic!

Korean: 나는 그때 처음 해봤는데 손맛이라는 걸 처음 느껴봤어 키키
English: I tried it for the first time then and it was the first time I felt the taste of the hand Kiki
Have you caught a lot of meat?
Oh, the taste~ Kiki

Korean: 응응. 할머니 덕에 바다 낚시, 민물 낚시, 빙어 낚시 골고루 해본 것 같긴 해.
English: Yeah, yeah. Thanks to my grandmother, I think I've tried saltwater fishing, freshwater fishing, and ice fishing.
Do you like any other sports?

Korean: 아니 운동은 그렇게 좋아하지 않는데 수영은 또 좋아해!
English: No, I don't really like exercising, but I like swimming!
Do you know how to freestyle?

Korean: 우와! 나는 물을 좋아하지만 개헤엄도 겨우 치는 수준이야...
English: Wow! I love water, but I can barely paddle...
Do you like hiking?

Korean: 아니 등산 너무 예전에 가고 안 갔는데 집 앞 언덕도 잘 안 올라가는걸...
English: No, it's been a while since I went hiking, and I don't even go up the hill in front of my house...
So have you been hiking recently?
I'm having a hard time too, not really... hehe

Korean: 4년 전에 한라산 갔었는데 너무 힘들어서 다시는 가고 싶지 않아!
English: I went to Hallasan four years ago, but it was so hard that I never want to go again!
So, personally, I think mountain climbing is too difficult...

Korean: 그냥 동네 뒷산 이 정도서부터 시작해야 되는데...
English: I guess we should just start from the mountain behind the neighborhood...
But why is it Mt. Halla so suddenly?

Korean: 그러니까. 집 뒤에 동산 정도밖에 안 가는데 아주 하룻강아지 범 무서운 줄 몰랐지!
English: That's why. I didn't know that a tiger could be so scary when it was only a little hill behind the house!
So, do you like camping?

Korean: 키키 캠핑은 하면 좋아할 거 같긴 한데... 따로 막 해 본 적은 없어.
English: Kiki seems like she'd enjoy camping, but... I've never actually tried it.
Does camping include car camping?
I want to try a little bit of car camping!
Then let's include car camping too!

Korean: 차박 나도 궁금한데 좁은 곳에서 약간 불편하게 자는 게 걱정이긴 한데 재밌을 거 같아!
English: I'm also curious about car camping. I'm worried about sleeping in a small space and feeling a little uncomfortable, but it sounds like fun!

Korean: 티비에서 차박하는 거 보는데 거기 이쁘게 꾸며 놓으면 진짜 이쁘고 그래서 한번 해보고 싶어!
English: I saw people on TV doing car camping, and it looks really pretty when they decorate it, so I want to try it someday!
Does your sister like games?
I don't hate it, I don't like it!

Korean: 리듬 게임이라고 해야 되나 그거만 좋아해 키키
English: I guess you could call it a rhythm game, but I only like that Kiki
Oh, I like rhythm games too!

Korean: 알투비트, 오디션 등등. 또 뭐가 있지?
English: R2Beat, audition, etc. What else is there?

Korean: 근데 탭소닉 같은 것도 리듬 게임 맞지?
English: But isn't something like Tapsonic also a rhythm game?

Korean: 어, 맞지 맞지! 그거 되게 옛날 게임 맞나?
English: Oh, right, right! Is that a really old game?

Korean: 맞아 그걸 하는 건 아니고 그거와 같은 슈스엠이라고 그걸 하는데 모르겠지?
English: Right, that's not what they're doing, but they're doing something similar to that, so you don't know?
Yeah. I don't know much about the game called Shusm...
Is that a phone game? A computer game?

Korean: 폰 게임인데! 나도 친구가 시작해서 한 건데 노래에 맞춰서 탭소닉처럼 하는 그런 거야~
English: It's a phone game! I started playing it because my friend started it. It's like tapsonic, with the rhythm of the song~

Korean: 꽤 오래 해서 나름 상위 레벨인 편이야 키키
English: I've been doing this for quite some time, so I'm pretty high level Kiki

Korean: 오~ 멋쟁이 ^^ 그러면 보드 게임도 좋아해?
English: Oh~ Cool ^^ Then do you like board games too?
Yeah! I like Lumikub. What about you?

Korean: 나는 루미큐브 할 줄 몰라... 할리갈리는 좋아해!
English: I don't know how to play Lumikub... I like Halli Galli!
Halli Galli is so much fun!

Korean: 나도 루미큐브 배우는데 좀 걸렸어 이게 어렵더라...
English: It took me a while to learn Lumikub too, it was hard...
Should I teach you something?
Yeah! Teach me! Promise, promise!

Korean: 배워서 스승을 이기는 제자가 돼 보겠어!
English: I will learn and become a disciple who can overcome his master!

Korean: 내가 물론 스승 소리까지 그 정도는 아닌데 최선을 다해보겠어...
English: Of course, I'm not that good of a teacher, but I'll try my best...

Korean: 우선 근데 루미큐브 어디서 구해? 보드 게임 카페 가야 되나...
English: First of all, where can I get a Lumikub? Do I have to go to a board game cafe?
Um... maybe?

Korean: 그럼 거리 두기 풀리면 보드 게임 카페도 가자~ 약속 약속!
English: Then, when social distancing is lifted, let's go to a board game cafe too~ Promise, promise!

Korean: 우리 갈 데가 너무 많아졌다 잊지 않도록 해 키키
English: We have so many places to go, don't forget Kiki

Korean: 여행 갈 때 꼭 챙겨 가는 것이 있어?
English: Is there something you always take with you when you travel?

Korean: 약을 꼭 챙겨가고... 묵주? 같은 거를 하고 가.
English: Make sure to bring your medicine... and a rosary or something.
Are you a bit of a coward?
Not a coward, but a man of sense~ ^^

Korean: 나도 약이나 밴드 같은 거 챙겨 가고!
English: I'm also taking some medicine and bandages!

Korean: 사실 평소에 짐이 많아서 특별한 건 없는 거 같아 하하
English: Actually, I don't think there's anything special because I usually have a lot of luggage haha

Korean: 너 짐 한 보따리지 맞아 알고 있어 키키
English: You're carrying a lot of luggage, Kiki, you know that

Korean: 모든 걸 가지고 있을 거 같아.
English: I feel like I have everything.
Have you ever traveled alone?

Korean: 아니. 평소에 혼자 잘 돌아다니고 타지는 반나절 정도는 혼자 돌아다녀 본 적 있는데 아예 박을 해 보진 않은 거 같아.
English: No. I usually walk around alone, and I've walked around alone for about half a day, but I don't think I've ever done it alone.
What about your sister?

Korean: 나도 돌아다니는 건 혼자 잘하는데 어디 가서 자고 그런 건 안 해봤어!
English: I'm good at walking around by myself, but I've never gone out and slept!
Oh, just like me!

Korean: 그러면 아예 자고 오는 여행으로 혼자 가 볼 의향은 있어?
English: Then, are you willing to go on a trip alone and just sleep over?

Korean: 응! 나 계획은 많이 세워봤는데 이게 실행이 안 되더라고?...
English: Yeah! I made a lot of plans, but they didn't work out?...
As expected, a coward...

Korean: 너는 혼자 가면 역시 제주도로 여행을 가고 싶어?
English: If you go alone, do you want to travel to Jeju Island?

Korean: 음, 꼭 제주도 아니어도 일단은 국내로 가 보고 싶어!
English: Well, I want to go to Korea at least, even if it's not necessarily Jeju Island!

Korean: 해외는 혼자 가 보기엔 약간 무섭고 심심할 거 같아서! 언니는?
English: I think it would be a bit scary and boring to go abroad alone! What about you, sister?
As expected, cowards travel domestically too...

Korean: 해외 여행은 근데 친구랑 가야 재밌어 해외 여행은 혼자 안 가고 싶어!
English: Traveling abroad is more fun when you go with friends. I don't want to travel abroad alone!
Exactly! That's exactly what I thought ^^

Korean: 그러면 여행 가면 꼭 사오는 게 있어?
English: So, is there something you always buy when you travel?

Korean: 초코렛이랑 마그네틱을 꼭 사왔던 거 같아!
English: I think I bought some chocolate and a magnet!

Korean: 먹보는 역시 먹을 걸 빠뜨리지 않는 법...
English: A gourmet never misses out on anything to eat...
You probably bought some chocolate too, right?

Korean: 그럼 그럼! 그리고 제주도는 오메기떡 필수야!
English: Then, then! And in Jeju Island, you must try Omegi Tteok!
It's so delicious >,
I haven't tried omegi tteok! Is omegi tteok good?
Do you have any red beans?

Korean: 맞아! 안에 팥이 있고 겉에는 통팥으로 감싸져 있어!
English: That's right! There's red bean inside and it's wrapped in whole red beans on the outside!
I like red beans. What about you, sister?

Korean: 난 팥은 안 좋아하는데 또 시루떡은 좋아해 비슷한 건가?
English: I don't like red beans, but I like sirutteok. Is it similar?

Korean: 계속 비 소식 있던데 막상 비는 안 오네?
English: There's been rumors of rain, but it's not actually raining?

Korean: 아 오늘 비가 온다 그랬어? 몰랐어!
English: Oh, you said it was going to rain today? I didn't know!
Do you usually check the weather forecast?

Korean: 응! 나는 별명이 *시리라서 그날그날 기상예보를 잘 챙겨 봐!
English: Yeah! My nickname is *Siri, so I check the weather forecast every day!
You take good care of it!

Korean: 근데 저번에 비 온다고 내가 알려줬던 거 같은데
English: But I think I told you last time that it was going to rain

Korean: 그래서 잘 안보는 줄 알았어... 하하
English: So I thought you weren't watching... haha
Oh, because I take good care of it

Korean: 우산 챙기는 여부는 내 마음대로거든 하하 언닌 잘 챙겨 봐?
English: It's up to me whether I bring an umbrella or not haha. Unnie, take good care of it?

Korean: 나는 혼자 살아서 비 오는 건 정말 잘 챙겨보지!
English: I live alone so I really don't pay attention to the rain!

Korean: 그래서 항상 우산이 내 자리에 있잖아!
English: That's why I always have an umbrella by my side!
Are you an umbrella fairy?

Korean: 그러면 언니는 천둥 번개 치면 무서워하는 편이야?
English: So, are you afraid of thunder and lightning?
No! I'm not scared.

Korean: 나는 근데 바람이 그렇게 무섭던데 넌 바람 괜찮아?
English: But I'm so scared of the wind. Are you okay with the wind?
Oh, strong man.

Korean: 그런데 나도야 비바람도 나를 막을 수 없어.
English: But even I, the wind and rain can't stop me.
How are your eyes?

Korean: 눈은 이제 오면 차가 너무 막히니까 무서워...
English: It's scary when it snows now because the traffic is so congested...
I used to like snow, but not anymore.

Korean: 맞아. 비바람도 나를 막을 수 없지만 눈은 나를 막을 수 있어.
English: That's right. Neither rain nor wind can stop me, but snow can stop me.
Do you like snowball fights?

Korean: 눈싸움 안 한 지 너무 오래 됐는데?
English: Has it been so long since we had a snowball fight?
Are you still having a snowball fight?
No, actually, it's been a really long time for me too...
But I liked it.
How about making a snowball fight?
Now it's cold so I don't want to go out... Kiki

Korean: 눈은 올 때 베란다에서 구경하는 게 최고!
English: The best way to enjoy snow is from the veranda!

Korean: 맞아! 눈이랑 비는 실내에서 바라만 보는 게 좋아.
English: That's right! I like just looking at the snow and rain from inside.

Korean: 맞아 이제 실내에서 애기들 노는 거 보면 돼~
English: That's right, now you can watch the babies playing indoors~

Korean: 드디어 다음 주부터 20, 30대 백신 신청 기간이야?
English: Is next week finally the vaccine application period for people in their 20s and 30s?

Korean: 응 드디어 우리 주사 맞는 거야!
English: Yeah, we're finally getting our shots!
But if I apply this time, will it be in September?

Korean: 응 확실하진 않은데 아마 그랬던 거 같아!
English: Yeah, I'm not sure, but I think it might have been like that!
Sister, what day is your application due?
I think it's August 12th? You?
I'm 9 days old!

Korean: 신청 기간 첫날이라서 너무 떨려... 어떡하지...?
English: It's the first day of the application period, so I'm so nervous... What should I do...?

Korean: 그거 그냥 백신 맞는 날짜랑 병원만 신청하면 되는 건가...
English: Is it okay to just apply for the date of vaccination and the hospital?

Korean: 아마 이제는 서버 다운 안 되지 않을까라고 조금 희망을 걸어보려고
English: I'm trying to have some hope that the server won't go down anymore.
I'll have to look into the exact procedure again.

Korean: 백신 맞으면 다음 날까지 쉬고 싶다. ㅠㅠ 그치?
English: After getting vaccinated, I want to rest until the next day. Right?

Korean: 응! 그거 맞았는데 그 다음날 아프고 출근해야 되는 거면 너무 힘들 거 같아...
English: Yeah! That's right, but if I'm sick the next day and have to go to work, it's going to be so hard...
What day do you plan to apply?

Korean: 금토가 좋을 텐데 엄청 몰릴 거 같아서 걱정이네... 언니는?
English: Friday and Saturday would be nice, but I'm worried it'll be really crowded... What about you, Unnie?

Korean: 나도 금요일 저녁에 맞고 싶은데 할 수 있을지 모르겠다 ㅜㅜ
English: I want to meet you on Friday night too, but I don't know if I can ㅜㅜ

Korean: 안 아파야 할 텐데 우리 화이자 맞는 거지?
English: It shouldn't hurt, but we're getting Pfizer, right?
Yeah! This time, it's Pfizer and Moderna!
Is there anyone around you who has been vaccinated?

Korean: 내 친구 병원 근무해서 아스트라 맞았어
English: My friend works at a hospital and got AstraZeneca.

Korean: 친구는 열 조금 나는 거 말고는 부작용 없었다던데
English: My friend said there were no side effects other than a slight fever.

Korean: 나도 아무 이상 없었으면 좋겠어 부작용 무서워... ㅜㅜ
English: I hope there's nothing wrong with me, I'm scared of side effects... ㅜㅜ
My mom also got AstraZeneca!

Korean: 하루 이틀 약간 감기 기운 있으셨대 ㅠㅠ
English: I heard you had a bit of a cold for a day or two ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아 우리 엄마는 피곤한 거 말고는 없었는데...
English: Oh, my mom was nothing but tired...

Korean: 우리는 그냥 조용히 넘어갔으면 좋겠다... 그치?
English: We'd like it to just go quietly... right?

Korean: 그러니까! ㅠㅠ 우리 둘 다 괜찮길 바래 보자!
English: So! ㅠㅠ Let's hope we're both okay!

Korean: 그럼 그럼 백신 신청 성공하고 팁 알려주길 바래!
English: Well then, I hope you succeed in applying for the vaccine and give me some tips!
The number of confirmed coronavirus cases in Tokyo has exceeded 5,000...

Korean: 정말? 올림픽 기간인데 그거 괜찮은 건가...
English: Really? It's the Olympics, is that okay...?

Korean: 응 올림픽 때문에 더 늘었나 봐...
English: Yeah, I guess it increased because of the Olympics...
I'm also really worried about our country's athletes...

Korean: 그니까 그거 올림픽 선수들 안에서도 조금 집단 감염 있는 거 같던데
English: So, it seems like there is some group infection among the Olympic athletes.
Can I continue, please...?
Oh my gosh... What should I do...
Everyone needs to come back safely ㅠㅠ
That's why I'm worried.

Korean: 나는 올림픽 배구 보는데 결승 갈 수도 있을 거 같으니까 제발 문제 없이 끝까지 했으면 좋겠다...
English: I'm watching the Olympic volleyball, and I think they might make it to the finals, so I hope they make it to the end without any problems...
I know.
Health comes before grades!

Korean: 방역에 조금 더 신경 썼으면 좋았을걸...
English: I wish they had paid a little more attention to quarantine...

Korean: 그니까 정말 어딜 가나 코로나가 말썽이네.
English: So, really, wherever you go, Corona is causing trouble.

Korean: 그래서 아까 배구 얘기해서 말인데 어제 배구한 거 터키전 봤어?
English: So, since we were talking about volleyball earlier, did you watch the volleyball game against Turkey yesterday?
No, I didn't see it, I just saw the highlights!
It was really so dramatic!?

Korean: 나도 하이라이트만 봤는데 또 마지막 세트에서 역전해서 또 이겼잖아!
English: I only watched the highlights, but they came back from behind in the last set and won again!

Korean: 진짜 그거 생방송으로 봤으면 심장 아팠을 거 같아...
English: I think my heart would have hurt if I had seen that live...
Yeah, it's so cool! ㅠㅠ

Korean: 세계적인 대회에서는 정말 떨릴 텐데... 그치?
English: You must be really nervous at a world-class competition... right?
I absolutely can't... ㅜㅜ

Korean: 터키에서 이번에 큰불이 나서 터키 선수들이 더 잘하고 싶었다고 한 뉴스까지 보긴 했는데
English: I even saw a news report that said that the Turkish athletes wanted to do better after the recent fire in Türkiye.

Korean: 조금 마음이 아팠지만 잘 이겨서 기뻤어!
English: It was a little heartbreaking, but I'm glad we won!

Korean: 맞아 나도 그 소식 들었어... ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, I heard that news too... ㅠㅠ
It hasn't evolved yet...
This is really a big deal
Still? Oh, I didn't know that...

Korean: 불이 며칠째 나고 있는 거 아니야 그러면?
English: Hasn't the fire been burning for several days?
Yeah, that's right ㅠㅠ

Korean: 빨리 진화하고 인명 피해가 적었으면 좋겠다!
English: I hope it evolves quickly and causes fewer casualties!

Korean: 아 터키 뉴스 제대로 안 봐서 몰랐는데 더 심각한 것 같네...
English: Ah, I didn't know because I didn't watch Turkish news properly, but it seems more serious...

Korean: 언니는 미용적으로 신경 쓰는 부분이 있어?
English: Sister, is there anything you care about aesthetically?
I always spray perfume!

Korean: 향수를 제일 신경 쓰는 거 같아 너는?
English: I think you care the most about perfume.

Korean: 나는 원래 화장이었는데 지금은 화장을 거의 안 해.
English: I used to wear makeup, but now I hardly ever wear makeup.

Korean: 나는 원래 화장을 잘 안 하는 편이었는데 지금 더 안 하는 거 같아.
English: I originally didn't wear much makeup, but I think I don't wear it even more now.

Korean: 너는 화장하면 어디를 제일 공들여서 했어?
English: When you put on makeup, where do you put the most effort?
I'm into lip these days!

Korean: 요즘은 마스크 때문에 다양하게 구매는 안 하는 거 같아 ㅠㅠ
English: I don't think people are buying a lot of different things these days because of the masks ㅠㅠ
What about your sister?

Korean: 아 나는 화장하면 아이쉐도우를 제일 공들여서 했어!
English: Ah, when I put on makeup, I put the most effort into eyeshadow!
I think I used about 5 colors?
Oh, you use it a lot!
Do you like shiny pearls?

Korean: 응 나는 반짝이는 걸 써야 이제 눈이 더 커 보이고 그래서 입자가 작은 반짝이를 잘 썼지!
English: Yeah I use glitter so my eyes look bigger now so I use glitter with small particles!
What brand do you mainly use?

Korean: 오~ 딱히 제일 좋아하는 브랜드는 없는데 립 제품은 맥이 제일 무난하면서 색깔도 많아서 좋은 거 같아.
English: Oh~ I don't really have a favorite brand, but I think MAC lip products are the best because they are versatile and come in a variety of colors.
What about your sister?

Korean: 응 나는 립은 페리페라를 주로 써.
English: Yeah, I mainly use Peripera for my lips.
I like the color there
I use a type of lip product called Airy Velvet.
Have you tried it?

Korean: 나 엄청 예전에 한 번 써 봤어!
English: I used it once a long time ago!

Korean: 그럼 언니는 틴트 종류를 좋아해 립스틱 종류를 좋아해?
English: So, do you like tints or lipsticks?

Korean: 나는 그 건조한 걸 진짜 싫어해서 립스틱 종류는 잘 안 발라!
English: I really hate that dry feeling so I don't really wear lipstick!
you?

Korean: 오, 나는 반대로 매트 립을 좋아하고 틴트보다는 립스틱을 좋아해!
English: Oh, I on the contrary like matte lips and I like lipstick more than tint!
Oh, that's totally the opposite of me!
That's why I always apply Nivea.
Have you seen me apply it often?
Oh really?
I got it now! ^^

Korean: 나는 입술이 별로 안 건조해서 사실 립밤도 잘 안 발라 하하
English: My lips aren't that dry, so I don't really use lip balm haha

Korean: 나는 학생 때부터 건조했어서 아직까지도 계속 바르는 중이야!
English: I've had dry skin since I was a student, so I still keep applying it!

Korean: 건강을 위해서 하는 작은 습관 같은 게 있어?
English: Are there any little habits you do for your health?
I tend to go to bed early...
Do you know what time I sleep?
Yeah, I know!
I think sleep is really important.

Korean: 나는 늦게 자서 체력이 이 모양인가...
English: I slept late so my stamina is like this...

Korean: 너는 늦게 자고 일찍 일어나는 거 같아
English: You seem to go to bed late and wake up early.

Korean: 그래서 더 피곤한 걸 수 있다고
English: So you might be more tired

Korean: 하루에 7시간은 자야 좀 건강해지는 느낌이 들어...
English: I feel healthier if I sleep 7 hours a day...
Do you have a habit?
I drink a lot of water.

Korean: 근데 습관이라기보다는 원래 좀 많이 마시는 편이야!
English: But rather than saying it's a habit, I'm just someone who drinks a lot!
Oh, that's a really good habit.

Korean: 나는 물을 너무 안 마셔서 걱정인데!
English: I'm worried because I don't drink enough water!
So how much do you drink a day?

Korean: 정확하진 않은데 그래도 항상 1리터 이상은 마시는 거 같아!
English: I'm not sure, but I think I always drink more than a liter!
Sister, try increasing it little by little!

Korean: 나는 진짜 일하면서는 500미리도 안 마시는 거 같아.
English: I don't think I drink even 500 ml while I'm working.
Is it okay to drink carbonated water?
Carbonated water is also good.

Korean: 하지만 탄산을 또 너무 과다 섭취하면 이빨에 안 좋은가?
English: But is it bad for your teeth if you consume too much carbonated beverages?
I'm not sure... haha
I can't drink plain water.

Korean: 뭐라도 티백이라도 넣어야 좀 들어가 물이...
English: You need to put in something, even a tea bag, so that some water can go in...

Korean: 내 친구도 그래서 차를 마시거나 탄산수를 마시더라!
English: My friend also drinks tea or soda because of that!

Korean: 그러면 우리 스트레칭을 수시로 해 보자!
English: Then let's do some stretching often!
I really need to stretch

Korean: 그럼 스트레칭을 할 때 나 좀 데려가서 같이 해줘.
English: Then, when you do stretching, take me with you.
Yeah yeah I'll tell you!
It's good to just turn your neck often!

Korean: 그래? 나는 손목이랑 허리가 안 좋은 편인데
English: Really? My wrists and back are not in good shape.
Tell me some stretching related to this!
Yeah! I'll teach you some wrist stretches too.
Let's do it together and take care of our health ^^
okay!
Then stretching only trusts you!
Sister, do you use Market Kurly well?
I used it once last month and it was good
Great for people who live alone!
Yeah. Early morning delivery is really convenient.
What about Coupang?

Korean: 쿠팡은 이제는 잘 사용 안 해!
English: I don't use Coupang much anymore!
Dawn delivery is okay too~
Oh, thanks for the recommendation!
I'll try using SSG next time!
What do you usually order?
Just order something to eat!
Frozen dumplings or meal kit?
Have you tried a meal kit?
no!
Is it that comfortable?
What kind of food is there?

Korean: 나는 감바스랑 파스타 먹었는데 진짜 맛있고 가격도 저렴해!
English: I had gambas and pasta and it was really delicious and cheap!

Korean: 프레시지 거니까 꼭 이용해 줘 한번!
English: It's a presage, so please use it at least once!
Oh, I love gambas.
thank you!
Have you ever ordered something like a frozen lunch box?

Korean: 냉동 도시락은 맛이 없어서 잘 안 시켜 먹어!
English: I don't order frozen lunch boxes very often because they don't taste good!
Are frozen lunch boxes okay?

Korean: 나 한 번 시켜보고 다시는 안 시켜... 하하
English: I tried it once and never tried it again... haha
First of all, the quantity is too small!
Ah, if the amount is too small, you are eliminated.
The meal kit is basically for two people, so be sure to order it!
Okay, okay!

Korean: 냉동 도시락은 양도 적고 너무 건강한 맛이야...
English: Frozen lunch boxes are small in size and taste so healthy...
Yeah, that's why I stopped eating it
Bibigo is delicious too, so order that too...

Korean: 알았어! 다음에 꼭 비비고를 시켜 먹어볼게.
English: Okay! Next time I'll definitely order Bibigo.

Korean: 응 내가 비비고 맛은 장담할 수 있어!
English: Yeah, I can guarantee the taste!
Sister, do you have a favorite celebrity?
Oh I really like EXO!
Oh, who do you like the most?

Korean: 나는 도경수를 제일 좋아하는데 사실 다 좋아하긴 해!
English: I like Do Kyungsoo the most, but I actually like them all!

Korean: 그럼 엑소 노래 뭐 제일 좋아해?
English: So what’s your favorite EXO song?
You know the winter song called Universe?
I absolutely love that song!

Korean: 그럼 도경수 영화 뭐 제일 좋아해?
English: Then what is your favorite Do Kyung Soo movie?

Korean: 형이라고 그 조정석이랑 나오는 거 그거!
English: That thing that comes out with Jo Jeong-seok, hyung!
Oh, I know, I know!
You're really good at acting.

Korean: 도경수 목소리 너무 좋은 거 같아. 그치?
English: I think Do Kyungsoo's voice is really nice. Don't you think so?
Okay then

Korean: 내가 그 목소리 들었다가 엑소 다 좋아하게 된 거잖아...
English: I started liking EXO after hearing that voice...

Korean: 도경수 영어 발음하는 거 혹시 들어봤니?
English: Have you ever heard Do Kyungsoo pronounce English?
Oh, I heard.
It was really great ^^
Do Kyungsoo's face is nice too, right?
Then your face is the best
Round face is the best the best!
He's handsome but small, so he looks like a fairy, right?

Korean: 나보다 조금 작을 수 있는데 그건 아무것도 아니지 키키
English: You may be a little smaller than me, but that's nothing Kiki
Please keep loving me hard!

Korean: 그럼 나는 해바라기 같이 계속 좋아할 예정이야!
English: Then I will continue to like you like a sunflower!
Sister, do you like Marvel movies?
I love it so much I've seen it all!
you?
I saw it all too!
Do you like Captain America?

Korean: 응 좋아하는데 나는 아이언맨이 최고라고 생각해!
English: Yeah I like it, but I think Iron Man is the best!
Yeah but I like Thor too
Ah, I don't really like Thor!
I like Spiderman too.
Yeah, me too.
What about Doctor Strange?

Korean: 닥터 스트레인지는 약간 잊고 있던 영웅인데...
English: Doctor Strange is a somewhat forgotten hero...
I think I forgot a little bit.
Don't forget!
I actually like Rocky.
Ah, Rocky, the movie is coming out soon!
So I hope it comes out quickly!
I'm waiting too
The Marvel universe is absolutely the best!

Korean: 맞아 맞아! 이번에 블랙위도우도 봐 줘!
English: That's right, that's right! This time, let's look at Black Widow too!
Oh right, I have to see that.
Was it fun?
Yeah, it's totally fun!
I hope you see it before you go down!
Yeah! I'll definitely watch Black Widow!
Do you want to go for a beer this evening?
Beer is totally good!
What kind of beer do you like?
I like lagers~

Korean: 어떤 음식이랑 맥주 먹는 게 좋아?
English: What kind of food do you like to eat with beer?

Korean: 음 나는 사실 맥주랑은 뭐든 다 좋아해서 과자랑 먹는 것도 좋고 떡볶이나 피자 등등 있지
English: Well, I actually like everything with beer, so I like eating it with snacks, tteokbokki, pizza, etc.

Korean: 배달 시켜 먹을 때 맥주도 같이 시킨 적 있어?
English: Have you ever ordered beer along with your food delivery?

Korean: 응 치킨 시킬 때 생맥주 같이 시킨 적 있는데 아무래도 매장에서 먹는 거보다는 별루더라 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, I ordered draft beer with my chicken once, but it wasn't as good as eating it in the restaurant ㅠㅠ
Have you ever ordered it?
No I don't have any

Korean: 그렇게 오면 확실히 맛이 별로일 거라고 생각해서 맥주 좋아하는 나는 내키지 않더라고
English: I didn't feel like drinking it because I thought it would definitely taste bad if I came that way. I like beer so I didn't feel like drinking it.
What do you usually drink beer with?

Korean: 나도 피자나 치킨이랑 먹는 것도 좋아하고 그냥 티비 보면서 맥주만 마실 때도 있지!
English: I also like eating pizza or chicken, and sometimes I just drink beer while watching TV!
Do you usually eat late-night snacks?
I love late night snacks

Korean: 생각만 해도 좋은데 잘 못 먹어 소화가 안 되는 편이라...
English: It's good to just think about it, but I don't eat well so I have trouble digesting it...
What would be good for a late night snack?
I like chicken feet!

Korean: 라면도 밤에 먹으면 맛있는데 아침에 얼굴 퉁퉁 붓긴 하지
English: Ramen tastes good when you eat it at night, but your face will be puffy in the morning.
Chicken feet, my mouth is watering haha
I like it a lot too
And I highly recommend the gopchang too
Don't you like that either?
Oh, I like tripe too...
Let's go eat gopchang next time!
There is a good restaurant in Seolleung Station
Do you want to go right now?

Korean: 곱창은 그럼 소곱창 좋아해 돼지곱창 좋아해?
English: Then do you like beef tripe or pork tripe?
I like beef tripe!
Pigs smell so I don't like them...
you?
You have a weak stomach

Korean: 나는 가리지 않고 둘 다 좋아해
English: I like both without any distinction
What are you planning to eat for dinner tonight?

Korean: 그럼 오늘 저녁은 피자에 맥주 먹을까?
English: So, shall we have pizza and beer for dinner tonight?
Totally good
Definitely call!

Korean: 우리 집 전세 계약이 이제 끝나가서 이사 갈 집 알아봐야 돼 ㅠㅠ
English: My house lease is about to end, so I have to find a new house to move into ㅠㅠ
Oh really?

Korean: 다음 집은 어떤 집으로 갈 거야?
English: What house are you going to go to next?

Korean: 다음에는 주택도 살아보고 싶어서 고민 중이야!
English: I'm thinking about buying a house next time!
I thought it would be nice to have a yard
A house with a yard is nice!

Korean: 근데 그런 집은 너무 비싸서 좋은데 구하기가 쉽지 않더라
English: But those houses are so expensive that it's hard to find them
I need to look into it carefully and buy it.
Are you interested in real estate?

Korean: 잘 알지는 못하는데 요즘에는 좀 관심을 가져보려고 하고 있어!
